Pre-Game Insights: Bulgaria hosts Northern Ireland in the second round of matches of the 2024/25 Nations League on Sunday.
Bulgaria got their Nations League campaign off to a solid start by securing a 0-0 away draw with Belarus.
Northern Ireland got their Nations League campaign off to a winning start with a 2-0 victory over Luxembourg at Windsor Park.
Bulgaria is ranked 88th in the world by FIFA and is in a rebuilding phase under head coach Ilian Iliev Snr.
Northern Ireland is ranked 74th by FIFA and is also in a rebuilding process under head coach Michael O'Neill.
Bulgaria has been unbeaten in seven matches under Ilian Iliev Snr, but with only one win.
Northern Ireland has won six out of 15 matches under Michael O'Neill.
The retirement of key players like Jonny Evans, Steven Davis, and Stuart Dallas has brought down the average age of the Northern Ireland squad.
Bulgaria has five draws in their last six matches, while Northern Ireland has recorded three wins in their last four matches.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match will take place at Hristo Botev Stadium, Plovdiv, Bulgaria on Sunday 8th September at 5 pm BST.
The match will be broadcast live on ITVX.
